Cyclonus and Scourge continue their upward flight, their movements
almost c=
asual as they maneuvered down the halls.

"Interesting" Scourge's voice gra=
ted out as the weapon attacks on them
stopped. "You must be right about thi=
s Hydras guy, Galvatron would
have never stopped firing on us until we were=
 DEAD!"

"Yes . . ." Cyclonus said calmly as they both stopped and transfor=
med
to look around. " . . . but the old Galvatron would not have used
other=
s to do his bidding, he wouldn't even use these machines. He
would have att=
acked us with his own weapons." 

Scourge nodded, agreeing, that is until t=
he ground rocked! 

"That was more than autoguns." Cyclonus said as he look=
ed in the
direction of the blast.

"Yep!" Scourge sniffed the air, a predat=
ory smile moving across his
face, "That was fusion power, I know that one!"=
 Scourge shook his
head, "But that's still not Galvatron, Magatron had powe=
r like that."

Cyclonus nodded, "Yes, quite." Turning to look at the exit t=
hat
beckoned to them leading out of the tower, he then looked back at the
h=
alls that led back from where they came. 

Finally Cyclonus said, "Come, th=
is confrontation should prove
interesting."

Scourge just shook his head, "=
You want him to be the one don't you?"

Cyclonus said nothing as they both =
transformed again and began to
moved back, heading now towards the interior=
 of Hydras' base. 

Preston
